column4: does anyone know of a program that show the disk usage, like "top" shows cpu usage ? (i can imagine that this aint so easy)
btw. are there benefits for root not having a password ?
Security, user friendly, it means you arn't likely to overwrite important stuff in nautilus, etc
well you KNOW your password, so u use sudo. what i wanted to know is it harder to hack a root without password, or so...

Well really, its a user thing. You'll find a lot of new users just use their root account for general work, its a big security risk, as root should only be used for admin (so that ports don't get left open, etc)
ubuntu is different on that, it has an all-in-one account, were anyone hacking in won't be able to issue sudo remotely (i beleive)
And like i said, it stops users renaming "var" to "SUPER HAPPY DIRECTORY"
and renaming "var" with sudo wouldnt work ?
It would, but by the time you know how to sudo and rename and use terminal, you would have decided against it.
